job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
-Work environment; for a psychiatric facility, it is clean, organized, and well-managed
-Staff/coworkers; my unit was staffed with some amazing people. I learned and grew so much while working there. 
-Management; the hospital wouldn't be where it is today without the leadership at UNI. No one is perfect, but it is some of the best management I have worked with.
cons:
-The work. Working in mental health can be taxing, the burnout rate is high and some days can feel like they go on forever.
-The politics. Like any workplace, there is a significant level of workplace politics. There is also considerable nepotism within the organization. While I most approve of the management, it can be challenging to feel like you have a chain of command for resolving issues when your manager is married to the top of the chain. 
-The hours. It didn't bother me because I liked the weird hours, but it is a hospital that is in operation 24/7/365, which includes holidays and weekends, so if you're not prepared for that, it may not be the place for you.

job_title: Psychiatric Technician in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
UUHC, including UNI Inp/OP services, provides incredible patient care and a really solid pay and benefit package to employees and the families of employees. The vast majority of the culture, in my experience, puts patient care as the absolute first priority, and with that in mind UUHC is able to attract and retain incredible scientist-physicians who provide the best care coupled with cutting edge research that keeps Utah on the forefront, nationwide.
If i ever need medical care, of any type, i will be going to The U...
cons: There is a small, small minority of people who work here who just need to be fired... i dont know how to put it any more diplomatically than that. While i am grateful for the job security that I feel, there does come a time where stagnant or destructive employees just need to be encouraged to find another job.
